text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Friday. Reuters has no verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The international donors conference for reconstruction of Bosnia may be held in May although it still depends on the parties to meet requests by the International Monetary Fund, says office of the High Representative for Bosnia. Another option would be to hold a mini-donors conference but the amount of funds collected would be much smaller.
- Mehmed Zilic, minister of interior of the Moslem-Croat federation, calls on Sarajevans to report any suspicious persons during visit of Pope John Paul II.
- U.N. summit on human rights in Geneva has not acheived any positive steps as far as missing persons in Bosnia are concerned, says president of Bosnian commission for missing persons, Amor Masovic.

- Office of the international supervisor in the disputed town of Brcko, Bill Farrand, is due to be opened today and the international High Representative in Bosnia, Carl Bildt, is expected to attend the ceremony.

- Swiss government will give 10,000 German marks to every Bosnian refugee family who decides to return home. The same amount will be given to a municipality which takes that family, Swiss representatives in Bosnia say.

- The Federal Republic of Yugoslavia again offers to establish diplomatic relations with Bosnia. The offer was sent to Moslem chairman of the collective presidency, Alija Izetbegovic, and is now being analysed.

- The main obstacle for establishment of diplomatic ties between Bosnia and Yugoslavia is Belgrade's request for Bosnia to withdraw suit in international court charging millitary agression by Yugoslavia. So far, Sarajevo has refused.
- Manfred Novak, former U.N. envoy for missing persons, says he resigned because he did not get financial support from the international community for his job in Bosnia.
- Council of ministers again failed to agree on this year's budget and will again discuss this issue at its next meeting.
- Some 2.500 soldiers from Bosnian army corps will parade in Sarajevo's Olympic stadium on Thursday to celebrate the fifth anniversary of founding of army. -- Sarajevo newsroom, +387-71-663-864
